newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila Central Bank lowers March rediscount rate.
newsitem.headline: Manila Central Bank lowers March rediscount rate.

text.p: The Philippine Central Bank said on Wednesday it will lower the rediscount rate for March to 9.625 percent from the prevailing 9.673 percent.
The Central Bank's rediscounting window is a concessional facility to help exporters and the farm sector.
The monthly rediscount rate is pegged one percentage point below the average 91-day Treasury bill rate at the last auction of the preceding month.
From January 2 to February 24, loans from the rediscounting window reached 1.134 billion pesos, the Central Bank said.
